channel.title: ::players
channel.description: Hey guys, I have recently added the command ::players, and it works fine, but I was wondering how would I make it show WHO is online and there coordinates? I'm using Project Insanity.

item.title: ::players
item.dc:creator: @RyRyscape RyRyscape
item.description:
@RyRyscape wrote:

Rip the players command from torvapkz…

Read full topic

item.title: ::players
item.dc:creator: @purestmage74 purestmage74
item.description:
@purestmage74 wrote:

Obtain a Interface that has text lines on it, or create it.
Upon ::players make it send the player the interface, than create a for loop like so:

		int beginningLineID = 1; // Change
		int endingLineID = 10; // Change
		for (int i = beginningLineID; i < endingLineID; i++) {
			c.getPA().sendFrame126(c.playerName+" AbsX: "+c.absX+" AbsX: "+c.absY, i);
		}

Hope it helps some.

Read full topic

item.title: ::players
item.dc:creator: @tyb97 tyb97
item.description:
@tyb97 wrote:

That really isn’t a good idea seeing as that would print a lot but:

case "players":
for (Player p : World.getWorld.getPlayers()) {
    player.getActionSender().sendMessage("" + p.getName() + " " + p.getLocation().toString());
}

Read full topic
